section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Facility for food consumption" does not include parking spaces for vehicles as the sole accommodation.

"Food" does not include:
an alcoholic beverage as defined in § 5-101 of this article;
a soft drink or carbonated beverage; or
candy or confectionery.

"Premises" includes any building, grounds, parking lot, or other area that:
a food vendor owns or controls; or
another person makes available primarily for the use of the patrons of 1 or more food vendors.

"Substantial grocery or market business" means a business at which at least 10% of all sales of food are sales of grocery or market food items, not including food normally consumed on the premises even though it is packaged to carry out.

text.section: The sales and use tax does not apply to a sale of food stamp eligible food, as defined in 7 U.S.C. § 2012, bought with a food coupon issued in accordance with 7 U.S.C. § 2016.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the sales and use tax does not apply to a sale of food for consumption off the premises by a food vendor who operates a substantial grocery or market business at the same location where the food is sold.

The exemption under paragraph (1) of this subsection does not apply to:
food that the vendor serves for consumption on the premises of the buyer or of a third party; or
food for immediate consumption.

text.section: The sales and use tax does not apply to a sale of food or any beverage in a vehicle that is being operated in the State while in the course of interstate commerce.

The sales and use tax does not apply to a sale for consumption off the premises of:
crabs; or
seafood that is not prepared for immediate consumption.

section.section: The sales and use tax does not apply to the sale of snack food through a vending machine.

text.section: The sales and use tax does not apply to the sale through a vending machine of milk, fresh fruit, fresh vegetables, or yogurt.
